trans-unit.source: This topic provides a reference for the following API Management policies.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides a reference for the following API Management policies.

trans-unit.source: For information on adding and configuring policies, see <externalLink><linkText>Policies in API Management</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=398186</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information on adding and configuring policies, see <externalLink><linkText>Policies in API Management</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=398186</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#CheckHTTPHeader" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Check HTTP header</link> - Enforces existence and/or value of a HTTP Header.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#CheckHTTPHeader" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Check HTTP header</link> - Enforces existence and/or value of a HTTP Header.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#LimitCallRate" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limit call rate</link> - Prevents API usage spikes by limiting calls and/or the bandwidth consumption rate.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#LimitCallRate" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limit call rate</link> - Prevents API usage spikes by limiting calls and/or the bandwidth consumption rate.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#RestrictCallerIPs" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Restrict caller IPs</link> - Filters (allows/denies) calls from specific IP addresses and/or address ranges.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#RestrictCallerIPs" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Restrict caller IPs</link> - Filters (allows/denies) calls from specific IP addresses and/or address ranges.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#SetUsageQuota" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set usage quota</link> - Allows you to enforce a renewable or lifetime call volume and/or bandwidth quota.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#SetUsageQuota" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set usage quota</link> - Allows you to enforce a renewable or lifetime call volume and/or bandwidth quota.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#ValidateJWT" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Validate JWT</link> - Enforces existence and validity of a JWT extracted from either a specified HTTP Header or a specified query parameter.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#ValidateJWT" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Validate JWT</link> - Enforces existence and validity of a JWT extracted from either a specified HTTP Header or a specified query parameter.

trans-unit.source: Use the <codeInline>check-header</codeInline> policy to enforce that a request has a specified HTTP header.
trans-unit.target: Use the <codeInline>check-header</codeInline> policy to enforce that a request has a specified HTTP header.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally check to see if the header has a specific value or check for a range of allowed values.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally check to see if the header has a specific value or check for a range of allowed values.

trans-unit.source: If the check fails, the policy terminates request processing and returns the HTTP status code and error message specified by the policy.
trans-unit.target: If the check fails, the policy terminates request processing and returns the HTTP status code and error message specified by the policy.

trans-unit.source: When multiple value elements are specified, the check is considered a success if any one of the values is a match.
trans-unit.target: When multiple value elements are specified, the check is considered a success if any one of the values is a match.

trans-unit.source: Error message to return in the HTTP response body if the header doesn't exist or has an invalid value.
trans-unit.target: Error message to return in the HTTP response body if the header doesn't exist or has an invalid value.

trans-unit.source: This message must have any special characters properly escaped.
trans-unit.target: This message must have any special characters properly escaped.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Status code to return if the header doesn't exist or has an invalid value.
trans-unit.target: HTTP Status code to return if the header doesn't exist or has an invalid value.

trans-unit.source: The name of the HTTP Header to check.
trans-unit.target: The name of the HTTP Header to check.

trans-unit.source: Can be set to True or False.
trans-unit.target: Can be set to True or False.

trans-unit.source: If set to True case is ignored when the header value is compared against the set of acceptable values.
trans-unit.target: If set to True case is ignored when the header value is compared against the set of acceptable values.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>rate-limit</codeInline> policy prevents API usage spikes on a per subscription basis by limiting the call rate.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>rate-limit</codeInline> policy prevents API usage spikes on a per subscription basis by limiting the call rate.

trans-unit.source: When this policy is triggered the caller receives a <codeInline>429 Too Many Requests</codeInline> response status code.
trans-unit.target: When this policy is triggered the caller receives a <codeInline>429 Too Many Requests</codeInline> response status code.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used only once per policy document.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used only once per policy document.

trans-unit.source: <legacyLink xlink:href="ea160028-fc04-4782-aa26-4b8329df3448" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Policy expressions</legacyLink> cannot be used in any of the policy attributes for this policy.
trans-unit.target: <legacyLink xlink:href="ea160028-fc04-4782-aa26-4b8329df3448" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Policy expressions</legacyLink> cannot be used in any of the policy attributes for this policy.

trans-unit.source: Add one or more of these elements to impose a call rate limit on APIs within the product.
trans-unit.target: Add one or more of these elements to impose a call rate limit on APIs within the product.

trans-unit.source: Product and API call rate limits are applied independently.
trans-unit.target: Product and API call rate limits are applied independently.

trans-unit.source: Add one or more of these elements to impose a call rate limit on operations within an API.
trans-unit.target: Add one or more of these elements to impose a call rate limit on operations within an API.

trans-unit.source: Product, API, and operation call rate limits are applied independently.
trans-unit.target: Product, API, and operation call rate limits are applied independently.

trans-unit.source: The name of the API for which to apply the rate limit.
trans-unit.target: The name of the API for which to apply the rate limit.

trans-unit.source: The maximum total number of calls allowed during the time interval specified in the <codeInline>renewal-period</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The maximum total number of calls allowed during the time interval specified in the <codeInline>renewal-period</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The time period in seconds after which the quota resets.
trans-unit.target: The time period in seconds after which the quota resets.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>ip-filter</codeInline> policy filters (allows/denies) calls from specific IP addresses and/or address ranges.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>ip-filter</codeInline> policy filters (allows/denies) calls from specific IP addresses and/or address ranges.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a single IP address on which to filter.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a single IP address on which to filter.

trans-unit.source: At least one <codeInline>address</codeInline> or <codeInline>address-range</codeInline> element is required.
trans-unit.target: At least one <codeInline>address</codeInline> or <codeInline>address-range</codeInline> element is required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a range of IP address on which to filter.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a range of IP address on which to filter.

trans-unit.source: A range of IP addresses to allow or deny access for.
trans-unit.target: A range of IP addresses to allow or deny access for.

trans-unit.source: Required when the <codeInline>address-range</codeInline> element is used.
trans-unit.target: Required when the <codeInline>address-range</codeInline> element is used.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether calls should be allowed or not for the specified IP addresses and ranges.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether calls should be allowed or not for the specified IP addresses and ranges.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>quota</codeInline> policy enforces a renewable or lifetime call volume and/or bandwidth quota.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>quota</codeInline> policy enforces a renewable or lifetime call volume and/or bandwidth quota.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used only once per policy document.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used only once per policy document.

trans-unit.source: <legacyLink xlink:href="ea160028-fc04-4782-aa26-4b8329df3448" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Policy expressions</legacyLink> cannot be used in any of the policy attributes for this policy.
trans-unit.target: <legacyLink xlink:href="ea160028-fc04-4782-aa26-4b8329df3448" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Policy expressions</legacyLink> cannot be used in any of the policy attributes for this policy.

trans-unit.source: Add one or more of these elements to impose a quota on APIs within the product.
trans-unit.target: Add one or more of these elements to impose a quota on APIs within the product.

trans-unit.source: Product and API quotas are applied independently.
trans-unit.target: Product and API quotas are applied independently.

trans-unit.source: Add one or more of these elements to impose a quota on operations within an API.
trans-unit.target: Add one or more of these elements to impose a quota on operations within an API.

trans-unit.source: Product, API, and operation quotas are applied independently.
trans-unit.target: Product, API, and operation quotas are applied independently.

trans-unit.source: The name of the API or operation for which the quota applies.
trans-unit.target: The name of the API or operation for which the quota applies.

trans-unit.source: The maximum total number of kilobytes allowed during the time interval specified in the <codeInline>renewal-period</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The maximum total number of kilobytes allowed during the time interval specified in the <codeInline>renewal-period</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Either <codeInline>calls</codeInline>, <codeInline>bandwidth</codeInline>, or both together must be specified.
trans-unit.target: Either <codeInline>calls</codeInline>, <codeInline>bandwidth</codeInline>, or both together must be specified.

trans-unit.source: The maximum total number of calls allowed during the time interval specified in the <codeInline>renewal-period</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The maximum total number of calls allowed during the time interval specified in the <codeInline>renewal-period</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Either <codeInline>calls</codeInline>, <codeInline>bandwidth</codeInline>, or both together must be specified.
trans-unit.target: Either <codeInline>calls</codeInline>, <codeInline>bandwidth</codeInline>, or both together must be specified.

trans-unit.source: The time period in seconds after which the quota resets.
trans-unit.target: The time period in seconds after which the quota resets.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>validate-jwt</codeInline> policy enforces existence and validity of a JWT extracted from either a specified HTTP Header or a specified query parameter.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>validate-jwt</codeInline> policy enforces existence and validity of a JWT extracted from either a specified HTTP Header or a specified query parameter.

trans-unit.source: Authorize access to operations based on token claims
trans-unit.target: Authorize access to operations based on token claims

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to use the <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#ValidateJWT" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Validate JWT</link> policy to pre-authorize access to operations based on token claims.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to use the <link xlink:href="034febe3-465f-4840-9fc6-c448ef520b0f#ValidateJWT" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Validate JWT</link> policy to pre-authorize access to operations based on token claims.

trans-unit.source: For a demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <externalLink><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features with Vlad Vinogradsky</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/episode-177-more-api-management-features-with-vlad-vinogradsky/</linkUri></externalLink> and fast-forward to 13:50.
trans-unit.target: For a demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <externalLink><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features with Vlad Vinogradsky</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/episode-177-more-api-management-features-with-vlad-vinogradsky/</linkUri></externalLink> and fast-forward to 13:50.

trans-unit.source: Fast forward to 15:00 to see the policies configured in the policy editor and then to 18:50 for a demonstration of calling an operation from the developer portal both with and without the required authorization token.
trans-unit.target: Fast forward to 15:00 to see the policies configured in the policy editor and then to 18:50 for a demonstration of calling an operation from the developer portal both with and without the required authorization token.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of acceptable audience claims that can be present on the token.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of acceptable audience claims that can be present on the token.

trans-unit.source: If multiple audience values are present, then each value is tried until either all are exhausted (in which case validation fails) or until one succeeds.
trans-unit.target: If multiple audience values are present, then each value is tried until either all are exhausted (in which case validation fails) or until one succeeds.

trans-unit.source: At least one audience must be specified.
trans-unit.target: At least one audience must be specified.

trans-unit.source: A list of Base64-encoded security keys used to validate signed tokens.
trans-unit.target: A list of Base64-encoded security keys used to validate signed tokens.

trans-unit.source: If multiple security keys are present, then each key is tried until either all are exhausted (in which case validation fails) or until one succeeds (useful for token rollover).
trans-unit.target: If multiple security keys are present, then each key is tried until either all are exhausted (in which case validation fails) or until one succeeds (useful for token rollover).

trans-unit.source: Key elements have an optional <codeInline>id</codeInline> attribute used to match against <codeInline>kid</codeInline> claim.
trans-unit.target: Key elements have an optional <codeInline>id</codeInline> attribute used to match against <codeInline>kid</codeInline> claim.

trans-unit.source: A list of acceptable principals that issued the token.
trans-unit.target: A list of acceptable principals that issued the token.

trans-unit.source: If multiple issuer values are present, then each value is tried until either all are exhausted (in which case validation fails) or until one succeeds.
trans-unit.target: If multiple issuer values are present, then each value is tried until either all are exhausted (in which case validation fails) or until one succeeds.

trans-unit.source: The element used for specifying a compliant Open ID configuration endpoint from which signing keys and issuer can be obtained.
trans-unit.target: The element used for specifying a compliant Open ID configuration endpoint from which signing keys and issuer can be obtained.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of claims expected to be present on the token for it to be considered valid.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of claims expected to be present on the token for it to be considered valid.

trans-unit.source: When the <codeInline>match</codeInline> attribute is set to <codeInline>all</codeInline> every claim value in the policy must be present in the token for validation to succeed.
trans-unit.target: When the <codeInline>match</codeInline> attribute is set to <codeInline>all</codeInline> every claim value in the policy must be present in the token for validation to succeed.

trans-unit.source: When the <codeInline>match</codeInline> attribute is set to <codeInline>any</codeInline> at least one claim must be present in the token for validation to succeed.
trans-unit.target: When the <codeInline>match</codeInline> attribute is set to <codeInline>any</codeInline> at least one claim must be present in the token for validation to succeed.

trans-unit.source: Master key for tokens issued by Azure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Master key for tokens issued by Azure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Provides some small leeway in case the token's expiration claim is present in the token and is past the current date / time.
trans-unit.target: Provides some small leeway in case the token's expiration claim is present in the token and is past the current date / time.

trans-unit.source: Error message to return in the HTTP response body if the JWT does not pass validation.
trans-unit.target: Error message to return in the HTTP response body if the JWT does not pass validation.

trans-unit.source: This message must have any special characters properly escaped.
trans-unit.target: This message must have any special characters properly escaped.

trans-unit.source: Default error message depends on validation issue, for example "JWT not present."
trans-unit.target: Default error message depends on validation issue, for example "JWT not present."

trans-unit.source: HTTP Status code to return if the JWT doesn't pass validation.
trans-unit.target: HTTP Status code to return if the JWT doesn't pass validation.

trans-unit.source: The name of the HTTP header holding the token.
trans-unit.target: The name of the HTTP header holding the token.

trans-unit.source: Either <codeInline>header-name</codeInline> or <codeInline>query-paremeter-name</codeInline> must be specified; but not both.
trans-unit.target: Either <codeInline>header-name</codeInline> or <codeInline>query-paremeter-name</codeInline> must be specified; but not both.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>id</codeInline> attribute on the <codeInline>key</codeInline> element allows you to specify the string that will be matched against <codeInline>kid</codeInline> claim in the token (if present) to find out the appropriate key to use for signature validation.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>id</codeInline> attribute on the <codeInline>key</codeInline> element allows you to specify the string that will be matched against <codeInline>kid</codeInline> claim in the token (if present) to find out the appropriate key to use for signature validation.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>match</codeInline> attribute on the <codeInline>claim</codeInline> element specifies whether every claim value in the policy must be present in the token for validation to succeed.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>match</codeInline> attribute on the <codeInline>claim</codeInline> element specifies whether every claim value in the policy must be present in the token for validation to succeed.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>all</codeInline> - every claim value in the policy must be present in the token for validation to succeed.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>all</codeInline> - every claim value in the policy must be present in the token for validation to succeed.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>any</codeInline> - at least one claim value must be present in the token for validation to succeed.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>any</codeInline> - at least one claim value must be present in the token for validation to succeed.

trans-unit.source: The name of the the query parameter holding the token.
trans-unit.target: The name of the the query parameter holding the token.

trans-unit.source: Either <codeInline>header-name</codeInline> or <codeInline>query-paremeter-name</codeInline> must be specified; but not both.
trans-unit.target: Either <codeInline>header-name</codeInline> or <codeInline>query-paremeter-name</codeInline> must be specified; but not both.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether an expiration claim is required in the token.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether an expiration claim is required in the token.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether a token is required to be signed.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether a token is required to be signed.

trans-unit.source: Open ID configuration endpoint URL from where Open ID configuration metadata can be obtained.
trans-unit.target: Open ID configuration endpoint URL from where Open ID configuration metadata can be obtained.

trans-unit.source: For Azure Active Directory use the following URL: <codeInline>https://login.windows.net/{tenant-name}/.well-known/openid-configuration</codeInline> substituting your directory tenant name, e.g. <codeInline>contoso.onmicrosoft.com</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For Azure Active Directory use the following URL: <codeInline>https://login.windows.net/{tenant-name}/.well-known/openid-configuration</codeInline> substituting your directory tenant name, e.g. <codeInline>contoso.onmicrosoft.com</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
